example: On the one hand, the job is well-paid, but on the other hand, it's very stressful.

definition: disagreeing with or disapproving of something
example: Many people are opposed to the new law. She is strongly opposed to animal testing.

definition: approximately (used after a number or quantity)
example: It will take an hour or so to get there. There were about 50 people or so at the party.

definition: except; apart from
example: I don't know anyone here other than you. There's nothing we can do other than wait.

definition: the possibility of something happening or being developed or used; qualities or abilities that may be developed and lead to future success or usefulness
example: This area has great potential for tourism. She has the potential to become a great musician.

definition: almost completely; mostly (informal)
example: I've pretty much finished my homework. The two situations are pretty much the same.

definition: before a particular time or event (formal)
example: All applications must be submitted prior to the deadline. Prior to his election, he was a lawyer.

definition: to be shown to be something after a period of time, or when you have all the information
example: The new system proved to be very effective. His initial fears proved to be unfounded.

definition: to suggest an idea, plan, or proposal for other people to consider
example: She put forward an interesting suggestion at the meeting. Several names have been put forward for the job.

definition: to create something by joining or combining different parts; to assemble
example: It took me hours to put the flat-pack furniture together. She put together a great presentation.

definition: the level of enjoyment, comfort, and health in someone's life
example: Access to green spaces can improve the quality of life in cities. Many factors affect a person's quality of life.

definition: including a variety of things between two particular points or limits
example: The hotel offers rooms ranging from standard to luxury suites. We discussed topics ranging from politics to sports.

definition: considered or thought of in a particular way
example: She is widely regarded as one of the best artists of her generation. The book is regarded as a classic.

definition: connected with what is happening or being discussed; pertinent
example: Please only provide information that is relevant to the case. Her comments were not relevant to the topic.

definition: to depend on or trust someone or something
example: You can rely on me to help you. The company relies heavily on government funding.

definition: a person looked to by others as an example to be imitated
example: Many athletes are seen as role models for young people. She tries to be a good role model for her children.

definition: to start a journey; to begin an activity with a particular aim or intention; to explain or present ideas clearly
example: They set out on their adventure early in the morning. She set out to break the world record. The report sets out the main findings of the research.

definition: not having enough of something
example: We are short of staff at the moment. I'm a bit short of cash until payday.

definition: in order to do something; with the purpose of doing something (formal)
example: He spoke quietly so as to not wake the baby. The government took measures so as to control inflation.

definition: approximately; similar to (used when you are not being exact)
example: It will cost something like $50. He said something like he was too busy to come.

definition: to deal with a problem or organize something successfully; to improve your behaviour or situation
example: Don't worry, I'll sort out the arrangements. He needs to sort himself out and find a job.

definition: to continue doing or using something and not change to anything else; to follow a plan or rule
example: You should stick to your diet if you want to lose weight. Let's stick to the original plan.

definition: likely to experience or be affected by something, often something unpleasant; dependent on something happening
example: Flights are subject to delay due to bad weather. The offer is subject to availability.

definition: to describe or express the main facts or characteristics of something in a short and clear form; to summarize
example: To sum up, we need to invest more in marketing. Can you sum up the main points of his argument?

definition: to make good use of an opportunity; to treat someone unfairly in order to get what you want
example: You should take advantage of this special offer. He took advantage of her kindness.

definition: to consider or remember something when judging a situation
example: We need to take all factors into account before making a decision. Her previous experience was taken into account.

definition: to begin to have control of or responsibility for something, especially in place of someone else; (of a company) to get control of another company
example: She will take over as manager next week. The larger company took over its smaller competitor.

definition: used to introduce an explanation or clarification of something that has just been said (often written as 'i.e.')
example: The conference is for three days, that is, from Monday to Wednesday. He's a vegetarian, that is, he doesn't eat meat.

definition: almost all of something; a very large proportion
example: The vast majority of students passed the exam. The vast majority of people agree with this.

definition: to change or develop into something different; to transform
example: The caterpillar turned into a beautiful butterfly. The small village has turned into a bustling town.

definition: to be someone's responsibility to make a decision or take action
example: It's up to you to decide what to do next. Whether we go or not is up to him.

definition: when you are dealing with or talking about a particular subject
example: When it comes to cooking, he's an expert. She's very knowledgeable when it comes to history.

definition: if something is true or not; if something happens or not (emphasizing that it does not matter which is the case)
example: I'm going to buy it whether or not you agree. We need to decide whether or not to proceed.

definition: to prefer to do or have something
example: I would rather stay home than go to the party. Would you rather have tea or coffee?

definition: of the age of
example: The study involved children aged 6 to 8. He is a man aged about 40.

definition: a place to live, work, stay, etc.
example: The hotel provides accommodation for up to 200 guests. Student accommodation can be expensive.

definition: having a strong wish to be successful, powerful, or rich
example: She is a very ambitious young lawyer. He has ambitious plans for his future.

definition: strong, healthy, and good at sports
example: He has an athletic build. She is very athletic and plays several sports.

definition: a large strong building, built in the past by a ruler or important person to protect the people inside from attack
example: We visited an old castle on our holiday. The castle stands on a hill overlooking the town.

definition: a man, typically on horseback, who herds and tends cattle, especially in the western US and as represented in westerns and popular culture.
example: The movie was a classic cowboy film. He dreamed of being a cowboy when he was a child.

definition: very pleased or happy
example: I was delighted to hear your good news. She was delighted with her birthday present.

definition: a coin of the US and Canada worth ten cents
example: Can you lend me a dime for the parking meter? It didn't cost a dime (meaning it was free or very cheap).

definition: a sweet, sticky yellow-brown substance made by bees that is spread on bread, etc. like jam
example: I like to put honey in my tea. Bees make honey from nectar.

definition: the first year of school, for children aged five (in the US and some other countries); a school or class for young children, usually between the ages of two and five (in the UK and some other countries)
example: My son will start kindergarten next year. She teaches kindergarten.

definition: a small flying insect that bites people and animals and sucks their blood, sometimes spreading disease
example: I got bitten by a mosquito last night. Mosquitoes can transmit malaria.

definition: a US or Canadian coin worth five cents; a hard, silver-white metal
example: He paid with three dimes and a nickel. Nickel is used in making stainless steel.

definition: a shop or part of a shop where medicines are prepared and sold; a drugstore
example: I need to go to the pharmacy to pick up my prescription. You can buy aspirin at any pharmacy.

definition: a path with a hard surface on one or both sides of a road, that people walk on (American English for 'pavement')
example: Please don't ride your bike on the sidewalk. The children were playing on the sidewalk.

definition: a wild animal of the dog family, that lives and hunts in groups
example: We heard a wolf howling in the distance. The story is about a lone wolf.
